title: The Easiest Universal Remote Codes & Programming Instructions for Vizio TVs

steps.title: Here are some common codes for Vizio TVs.
steps.content: Here are some common codes for Vizio TVs. Some universal remotes support using a two-, three-, four-, or five-digit code, which are listed here. If you don't see your remote listed in the previous chart or if your remote didn't accept those numbers, you can try these codes. 2-Digit Codes: 19 01 02 10 12 17 3-Digit Codes: 004 011 113 284 502 505 627 4-Digit Codes: 1758 0178 1756 0128 0117 1017 1078 0030 0056 0205 1292 1004 5-Digit Codes: 10178 10117 11756 01377 10885 10864 10120 [2] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on the Vizio TV.
steps.content: Turn on the Vizio TV. Press the physical "Power" button on the TV.

steps.title: Press the "TV" button on the universal remote for 5 seconds.
steps.content: Press the "TV" button on the universal remote for 5 seconds. The LED on the remote will flash twice and remain lit. Depending on the manufacturer of your universal remote, you may need to press "Setup" first until you see a red light.

steps.title: Enter the code.
steps.content: Enter the code. Pick a code from the chart of codes to program popular remotes with a Vizio TV or use one of the common short codes. If the code works, the LED will flash twice and turn off.

steps.title: Point the remote at the TV and press the "Power" button.
steps.content: Point the remote at the TV and press the "Power" button. If the code worked, the TV will turn off. If the TV doesn't turn off, try the programming steps again.

steps.title: Replace the batteries.
steps.content: Replace the batteries. Even if you just purchased the remote and it came with batteries, you want to replace them. A universal remote won't work properly without good batteries.

steps.title: Make sure the buttons aren't stuck.
steps.content: Make sure the buttons aren't stuck. Press all the buttons to make sure they aren't stuck. A stuck button can cause the universal remote not to work.

steps.title: Power cycle your TV then try again.
steps.content: Power cycle your TV then try again. Press the "Power" button on the TV to turn it off, then unplug it from power for 5 seconds. Plug it back in, then try the programming steps again!

steps.title: Clear any obstructions.
steps.content: Clear any obstructions. Many universal remotes rely on IR sensors to control your TV or other devices. If anything, like a decorative vase or cord cover, blocks the bottom corner of your TV, your remote most likely won't work.

steps.title: Check the buttons you're pressing.
steps.content: Check the buttons you're pressing. Many buttons only work for specific types of content. For example, the channel buttons won't work if you're watching something like Netflix; and only work for antenna or direct coaxial connections. "Play" and "Pause" only work for apps, like Netflix, not live TV. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Try another remote.
steps.content: Try another remote. If you can, get another remote and program it with your Vizio TV. You might be able to use that one instead.
